channel.title: 9 on World Wide Webber
channel.description: Recent content in 9 on World Wide Webber

item.title: The Coming of Age of Graph Databases
item.description: A short introduction to Neo4j and Cypher from the viewpoint of someone who has been with the technology for a long time.

item.title: Starting Graph Databases with Neo4j 2.0
item.description: An article on starting out with graphs and Neo4j 2.0, with a focus on the Cypher query language.

item.title: Exterminate! Your Database Woes with Neo4j
item.description: How to build a graph model in Neo4j, with examples from the long history of Doctor Who!

item.title: Service-oriented, Distributed, High-Performance Computing
item.description: An article on High Performance Computing (HPC) Grids built with SOA.

item.title: Stateful Interactions in Web Services: A Comparison of WS-Context and WS-ResourceFramework
item.description: An article how two competing/overlapping protocols each support the notion of conversational state in a system of Web Services.

item.title: Why WSDL is not Yet Another Object IDL
item.description: An article about how WSDL should be considered a contract language for message exchanges, rather than an IDL for object interactions.

item.title: Horses for Courses: Services, Objects, and Loose Coupling
item.description: An article on the differences between loose coupling in object-oriented and service-oriented systems, and how treating services like remote objects leads to tight coupling.

item.title: Introducting WS-CAF
item.description: An overview of the three-layered WS-CAF framework for distributed context, coordination, and transactions.

item.title: Demystifying Service Oriented Architectures
item.description: An article on designing services in a Service-Oriented Architecture.

item.title: Introducing BPEL4WS
item.description: The final article in a series of articles on safely executing complex business protocols over Web Services. This focuses on business processes supported by transactional Web Services.

item.title: Introducting WS-Transaction
item.description: The second and third in a series of articles on safely executing complex business protocols over Web Services. This focuses on atomic transactions and business activities layered atop WS-Coordination.

item.title: Introducting WS-Coordination
item.description: The first in a series of articles on safely executing complex business protocols over Web Services. This focuses on coordination as a general mechanism.

item.title: Building Transactional Web Services with OASIS BTP
item.description: A two-part article on building and composing transactional Web Services.

item.title: The Smart Money's on OASIS BTP
item.description: A guest editorial on using OASIS BTP execute transactions between Web Services.

item.title: Making Web Services Work
item.description: Magazine article on using OASIS BTP to enable transactions between Web Services.
